Employee Gift Ideas Under $5 by Kristie Lorette, Demand Media
Discover inexpensive gifts for employees.

Businesses often desire to give their employees a little something to say â??thanks.â? Unfortunately, when you are dealing with many employees and a tight budget, you might worry about finding the right thing inexpensively. Online companies usually offer discounts with high quantities of the same item, and you might earn free shipping with a large purchase. Many items can be purchased or made for less than $5 each.
Food Items
Something everyone can use and appreciate is food. Jar mixes make functional, attractive gifts that you create in your own kitchen. Dry ingredients for cookies, soups or brownies layered in a jar with instructions attached for adding specific liquids or perishable ingredients to complete the recipe are a nice touch. Jams, preserves, salsas or other specialty condiments can be store-bought or homemade for a simple gift. Put together a pasta dinner in a basket with pasta, a jar of sauce and a can of vegetables. A plate of homemade or store-bought cookies should score points with employees. Stay away from highly allergenic foods like nuts and anything perishable.
Home Items
You can purchase jar candles inexpensively, especially in bulk. Potholders and homemade cookbooks are handy and can be thematic by holiday or season. A unique new kitchen gadget is a fun conversation starter that people may rush home to try. Small plants make nice gifts, and may cost under $5 if presented in an inexpensive pot. Tote bags are useful these days, as people are making the effort to consume less plastic from the grocery store. Some websites personalize the bags with your company name or the employeesâ?? monograms.
Office Items
Some businesses opt to give employees gifts for use in the office. Believe it or not, you can find pen and pencil sets, journals and pocket calendars online for $5 or less. Calculators always come in handy. Business card holders imprinted with your company name or logo and presented to your employees are useful gifts. Small picture frames or albums are also cost-effective choices. Magnetic sculpture paperweights and pen holders serve a purpose and look nice on desks, and a coffee mug with an instant coffee or hot chocolate packet inside is good for the caffeine lovers.
Money
If you prefer not to hand out cash for a small gift, give an equivalent, like a sought-after gift card. A $5 gift card to a coffee shop provides a few coffees or a latte with a pastry. A gift card to a nearby fast food restaurant may be appreciated by employees who enjoy running out for lunch. Gift cards to movie rental stores can make most employees happy. Lottery tickets are also a fun alternative to giving cash.
